documents.document: @suzdal92 ...no. I think if I dropped a deuce in the sensory deprivation tank I might not be invited back to the spa. Just a hunch.
Nothing like a float session followed by a massage to make you just never want to do anything else ever again. #LazySunday
@Eden_Eats This is true. Meanwhile, I have to answer a skill-testing question to win a free small fries in McDonald's Monopoly.
So what if Beyoncé's eating for three? I can do that without even getting knocked up.

Life's too short for [blank].
*nudges life* PSST. THAT'S YOUR CUE.
TFW someone replies to my email and actually spells my name right. https://t.co/LfMldXfgzU
@MrLXC And if they weren't scented, GTFO.
@MrLXC Thank god for Super Smash Bros. for the WiiU - finally being allowed to beat the tar out of that little smirking bastard was bliss.
Office phone system still down. This may be the greatest start to a February of my entire life. #socialanxiety
I envy gaming consoles. I wish I could get away with just buggering off and updating for two hours any time someone asks me to do something.

IT guy broke all our phones.
As someone who hates talking on the phone with 10,000 nuances of fiery loathing, I say give the man a raise.

"Sorry to keep bothering you!"
No you're not. If you were actually sorry, you'd STOP. #ThingsICantReplyInBusinessEmails
I'm not a big fan of unsolicited dick pics so if you all could just stop posting photos of Trump to social media, that would be great.
@BadRealtyPhotos I'm not even going to swat that fly.
Is there a word for the kind of laziness where you end up going to more trouble trying not to go to any trouble?
My coworker just searched her entire desk for a single blank sheet of paper to print on rather than opening a ream to refill the copier.
But I realized people here would probably sooner just take the poster down and print over it than actually follow its instructions.
I've given serious thought to putting up a poster with instructions on how to reload the office printer with paper.
Me: *picking up greasy takeout in a hoodie and pajama pants* Cashier: Any plans for the evening? Me: https://t.co/9LeKDIJW28
My pearls of wisdom are usually more like polished turds.
Just pretend the next four years are Opposite Day and we'll all get through this somehow.
@suzdal92 They're just so soft and convenient and THERE, y'know?

OMG OMG OMG
WORK DAY PLEASE GO FASTER I HAVE VIDEO GAMES TO PLAY https://t.co/GfRY55og1O
@suzdal92 ...yeah this has been me more times than I ought to admit.
@RageMichelle I dunno, it would sure cut down on the amount of annoying neighbors I have to deal with.
Kudos to Trump for figuring out how to travel back in time, but do you have to take the whole country with you?
#OscarNoms are making me want to watch Arrival again while simultaneously seeking out vengeance for Amy Adams' lack of nomination.
Twitter is depressing today so I think I'll go get myself the largest mug of hot chocolate locally available to help ease the heartache.
@RageMichelle Pictured at right: There's Something About Mary, The Early Years.
Is it too late to take #InaugurationDay off work as bereavement leave?
#InaugurationDay https://t.co/CruUJTeiDB
@DadandBuried That's way too long a trip. I'm headed for Venus, myself. I hear those poison clouds are a breath of fresh air.
Letters to my miscellaneous anatomy. https://t.co/ovss1FWa8R

Spent all day yesterday avoiding my boss because she was sick. Coworker kicked today off by having a coughing fit at my desk.
Pray for me.
Client brought in giant tray of mochi as gift to the office. Only one here who likes mochi = me. Will power breaking down in 3...2...1...
A Rose by any other name would still have let a Jack by any other name freeze in the water because she can't share a friggin' floating door.
Not secretly adopting a dog and sneaking it into my apartment building is the hardest part of my day.
*wants to like tweet but can't on principle because of typo*
@carrot_rewards Everything's looking good now, thanks!
When you've walked 10km today but @carrot_rewards is down so all you have to show for it is your own stupid sense o… https://t.co/clvYB3PyE3
@carrot_rewards pretty please fix your app?

My husband just said the seven sexiest words in the English language:
"Those pants make your ass look good."
Anyone who invents the technology to finally stop me from accidentally biting the inside of my mouth can have all my money.

Oh hey, Twitter. Been a while. So. Is the world still awful?
...silly question.
Me: ...Sincerely, Jane Doe Every email response ever: Hi Jaiyyne, I got your email and...
Thinking about changing my name to Adele Dazeem at work because apparently no one I correspond with is ever going to spell it right anyway.
My New Year's resolution is to not accidentally write 2016 on anything, because apparently I believe in doing the impossible.
And no one gave it an award, it just decided to walk up on stage and grab one anyway.
2016 is like an actor who refuses to wrap up their goddamn Oscar speech, only instead of thanking people it's just killing them all off.

2:30am Christmas morning. Eating boozy chocolates and watching Hogfather.
This beats being a kid waiting for Santa any day.
Just realized I wore a white shirt to work during holiday chocolate season. This will almost certainly prove to have been a mistake.
@KateWhineHall I didn't know you worked at Starbucks!
Trek the Wars, or "When 2016 gives you lemons, make eggnog with Jean-Luc Picard and a Wookiee." https://t.co/YwNFcFmrym
TFW you go to get a hot cocoa from the coffee machine but it's almost out of mix so what you actually get resembles… https://t.co/F4l4bCOEVS
Fond memories of Nintendo tits and the days before "unknown search terms". | You sick bastards. https://t.co/n8qiRhZjZK
@AnneWheaton Best of both worlds: https://t.co/SrjCRiMnUp
@dduane I can just hear Nita Callahan grumbling about people who insist on adding seeds to perfectly good cake.
One of the anagrams for "Christmas" is "Mr. Shit Sac" and long story short I now have a new favorite nickname for Santa.
I'd be a lot less eager to leave work every day if my cubicle had heated seats like my car.
Stranger things. https://t.co/Uf4tZIX0oU
Sincere thanks to all the kind drivers who offered rides to those of us stranded at bus stations this morning thanks to #bcstorm.

Everything I've consumed so far today has contained some form of chocolate.
Some dreams DO come true.
A plague on the Nut house. https://t.co/BSj2ufk5KC
This is what evil looks like, kids. https://t.co/sAdDDI9KOT
Just got a Christmas card covered in black glitter from someone so now I have to write back and ask what I did to piss them off.

*somebody sneezes in the general direction of my blog*
WordPress: Your stats are booming!
Just burnt my lip on my hot chocolate and also there's a tickle in my throat. My first world problem game is strong today.
Step 1: Store thing in place where you "won't be able to miss it!" Step 2: Smugness. *later* Step 3: Can't find thing. Panic. - me, always
@LolaDLaval @AlbertaAltruist Derrick beat me to the proper response, so here's this inferior offering: https://t.co/bevVzpfNtI
I haven't stepped on a scale in a while because I figure any more disappointment and 2016 is just going to spontaneously implode on itself.
"Ugh. Don't you find it too hot in here?" he asked, looking directly at me shivering in my three layers of sweaters without a hint of irony.
May your Xmas be as merry and bright as the fire I started using your 5-page bragfest of a holiday letter as kindling. #BackHandedXmasWishes
This morning the moon hit my eye like a big pizza pie, and now I'm hungry.
@OhNoSheTwitnt OOOOO-klahoma where the guilt comes tripping down the plain...
@Breliloquy That's the route I took. 5/5 would be doped up out of my skull again.
@Breliloquy @YaAverageJoe Really not that awful. I lived in mortal fear of getting mine out but it's so much better with them gone.
Man, all these Star Wars re-release changes are getting ridiculous. @SmoshGames @TheJovenshire https://t.co/LAd8bbwMnc

This year was shit enough the first time around and now you're trying to make me relive it?
You sadistic fucks.
Funny how Facebook doesn't give you the option to report their "Year in Review 2016" TL spamming as harassment.
"Year's not over yet. I've got time to kill off a few more notable people before the holidays." - 2016
@TheOMGSpot 'scuse me while I just stalk your TL for the next few days and heart every goddamn tweet because KITTIES.
Me watching #YouTubeRewind. https://t.co/CtXO7sVB7P
@OMGFunkyKing I'm taking this as a sign that I need to go roundhouse kick all those goddamn defective snowflakes into confetti.
'Tis the season to bottle up my silent rage at all the store windows full of anatomically incorrect 8-sided snowflakes.
@MaraWilson Just start responding to everything they say with "It's a Festivus miracle!" and they'll leave you be soon enough.
2016 has been a crap sandwich and TIME making Trump their Person of the Year is just the soggy pickle on top.
@squaredbyrd @suzdal92 I came close. Spent a good minute just staring in disbelief at the carnage, wondering what I'd done to deserve this.
@suzdal92 @squaredbyrd Thanks for the trip down memory lane to that time I tripped up the stairs holding a salted caramel mocha. RIP mocha.
I haven't put on and removed so many articles of clothing in so short a time span since my theatre days.
Kudos to my coworker on somehow managing to program the office thermostat with the extreme temperature fluctuations of a menopausal woman.
@Breliloquy "Oh dear. I'm sorry, but we're going to have to go with someone with less experience."
My first mistake was bringing an entire package of chocolate-covered gingerbread cookies to work.
@OMGFunkyKing Send bourbon, then we'll talk.
Nothing gets a lady's attention quite like having a clump of wet snow fall off a roof and directly into her cleavage. Ask me how I know.

Things I've done today:
-gone to work -spent all morning looking out window at pretty snow and tweeting about dicks
@suzdal92 The imperative one. Managing to hide a giant trouser snake in some of the stuff I wore in high school would have been impressive.
@suzdal92 Little did my classmates know, when I wrote "HAGS" in their yearbooks it actually stood for "Have a giant stiffy!"
@suzdal92 At least, it will once I get home and write it in.
@suzdal92 If you look at my high school yearbook, it says I was voted, "Most likely to inspire idle remarks about dicks."
@suzdal92 I have zero regrets about deleting my original reply because this is so much better out of context.
